medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Sharp pain that is acute without clear etiology. Localized to umbilical region and constant. Towards evening, this radiated to RLQ. This is the patient's first ever episode. The patient states he is slightly nauseated due to pain and vomited once about 2 hours ago. Denies trauma, fevers, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and dysuria. The patient reports no appetite and has had normal flatus and bowel movement as of this morning. Experienced chills while in ED.
